rows.label: tev900393_MSG0010
rows.name: Heya. How's it poppin'?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0020
rows.name: ...Who, me?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0030
rows.name:
Oh yeah, worse than you for sure.
I don't think I can stomach the sight of
another pizza for a good long while...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0040
rows.name:
I swear I used to be able to put away
three of 'em like it was nothing...
Dammit, age really comes for us all.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0050
rows.name:
That's one benefit of the mim body.
No heartburn, no hangovers... One visit
to maintenance and you're good as new.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0060
rows.name:
Say, indulge my curiosity, pal.
Which would you say is better,
a mim or a real body?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_JNK0070
rows.name: Vote Mim

rows.label: tev900393_SEL0080
rows.name: Say it's mimeosome or bust.

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0090
rows.name:
That sounds pretty clear-cut, huh?
No huge wonder, I guess.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0100
rows.name:
On a galactic scale, humans aren't exactly
the best suited to thriving in space. We're
too squishy, too weak.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0110
rows.name:
Mims let us circumvent that. In theory,
they're sturdy enough to withstand many
light years of travel among the stars...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0120
rows.name:
A body that, with regular upkeep and
spare parts, can operate almost forever?
That's the peak of human achievement.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0130
rows.name:
Logically speaking, you're right.
It's mimeosomes or nothing, all the way.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_JNK0140
rows.name: Vote Organic

rows.label: tev900393_SEL0150
rows.name: Say a real human body is where it's at.

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0160
rows.name:
Ahh, the philosophical answer.
You mean like, you don't know if you're
even alive, without a real, meaty body?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0170
rows.name:
There was a lot of debate around that
even back on Earth. Not that anyone
could ever come to a consensus...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0180
rows.name:
By the way, I hear mims don't let you
switch off the pain response, except in
extreme circumstances. Is that true?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0190
rows.name:
Pain's a sensation unique to living beings.
If you lose that, you're not much different
from a machine...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0200
rows.name:
Suffering is counterproductive.
Some might say we should've gotten
rid of it by now, but we didn't...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0210
rows.name:
Looking at it from that angle, maybe
humanity hasn't accepted the mim
lifestyle as readily as I'd thought...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_JNK0220
rows.name: Discuss

rows.label: tev900393_SEL0230
rows.name: Ask if Al isn't tempted to switch to a mim.

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0240
rows.name:
You haven't forgotten, have you, buddy?
I need to stay biological to pilot the Ares.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0250
rows.name:
Maybe one day we'll be able to go back
and forth at will, like the Princess does,
but that day isn't today.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0260
rows.name:
As long as the Ares still needs me in the
flesh, I won't cheat on it by going mim.
What can I sayâ€”I'm a faithful guy.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_JNK0270
rows.name: Inquire

rows.label: tev900393_SEL0280
rows.name:
Ask why he needs to be biological
to pilot the Ares.

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0290
rows.name:
Good question... As much as we tried to
investigate the machine, no clear answer
has ever emerged.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0300
rows.name:
I think I have a hunch, though:
It's just how Ares likes it.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0310
rows.name:
Hey, what's that face for?
It's simple.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0320
rows.name:
He's gotta hug me, right? Dunno about
you, but I'd much rather hug a warm,
fleshy body than a cold, hard machine.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0330
rows.name:
...Okay, again, don't give me that look.
You gotta admit, it makes as much sense
as some technical mumbo-jumbo lecture.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0340
rows.name:
Phew... Let's cut the chat here, buddy.
I can feel the ol' guts whining again.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev900393_MSG0350
rows.name:
Ugh, I'm gonna go get an antacid...
I just hope you've still got organic
meds kicking around somewhere...[ST:wait ]
